intro: Gyrocheilos chorisepalus var. synsepalus, commonly known as the synsepalus variant of the gyrocheilos, is a unique member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, often multicolored flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically features elliptical, glossy leaves with a prominent midrib. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil. This variant is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
